sentence.Network_en: There was not much elbow room in the cockpit of a Snipe.
sentence.Network_cn: “沙锥鸟”战斗机的驾驶舱空间不太宽敞。

sentence.Network_en: Gunmen continued to snipe at people leaving their homes to find food.
sentence.Network_cn: 枪手不断伏击外出找寻食物的人。

sentence.Network_en: He was ordered to snipe at anyone moving about the camp.
sentence.Network_cn: 他奉令狙击任何在营地附近走动的人.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: probably of Scandinavian origin; compare with Icelandic mýrisnípa; obscurely related to Dutch snip and German Schnepfe

encyclopedia.content: 现代意义上的狙击手“Sniper”这个单词的词根“snipe”则在1832年第一次出现，源自于英军在印度边区的一种猎鸟活动。据说snipe是一种身体娇小、动作十分灵活的小鸟，要猎获这种鸟并不容易，需要相当不错的射击和潜行的技术，这种运动也就被叫做snipe。等到一次世界大战时，sniper成了军事上狙击手的通称，强调的除了射击之外，还有掩藏自己踪迹的能力。同样的，德文中的“Heckenschutze”与法文的“tireurembusque”也都有埋伏射手的意思，而中文译成了“狙击手”，勉强算是不差。

entry.def: If someone snipes at you, they criticize you.

example.ex: The Spanish media were still sniping at the British press yesterday.
example.tran: 西班牙媒体昨天仍然在攻击英国媒体。

entry.def: To snipe at someone means to shoot at them from a hidden position.

example.ex: Gunmen have repeatedly sniped at US Army positions...
example.tran: 持枪匪徒一再朝美军阵地放冷枪。

example.ex: A member of the security forces was killed in a sniping incident.
example.tran: 有一名安全部队成员在一场狙击战中被打死。

entry.def: A snipe is a type of bird with a very long beak which lives in wet areas of land.

means.word_mean: 1. Old or New World straight-billed game bird of the sandpiper family; of marshy areas; similar to the woodcocks
2. a gunshot from a concealed location
2. aim and shoot with great precision

sentences.sentence: "The editors of the left-leaning paper attacked the new House Speaker"

auth_sentence.content: When Sweden were going forward, attackers would jink, pivot and snipe and the British curtain would become torn.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: When Sweden were going forward, attackers would jink, pivot and snipe and the British curtain would become torn.

auth_sentence.content: Whilst one could snipe that that's the only way his chamber excursions could work, it would be unfair conjecture.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Whilst one could snipe that that's the only way his chamber excursions could work, it would be unfair conjecture.

auth_sentence.content: They hunt by sight, rather than by feel as do longer-billed waders like snipe.

means.word_mean: 伏击,狙击(未参战的敌人等)

sentences.en: A gunman sniped at them from the roof.
sentences.cn: 枪手从屋顶上向他们狙击。
